intro: Astragalus pavlovii, commonly known as Pavlov's milkvetch, is a flowering plant native to Central Asia. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its compound leaves and yellow pea-like flowers. The plant typically grows in arid and semi-arid environments, showing adaptability to harsh conditions. It has small, hairy stems and produces small, pod-like fruits that contain several seeds. Astragalus pavlovii is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is part of the diverse Astragalus genus, which includes many species with medicinal and ecological significance.
